metadata.title: UIBackgroundExtensionView | Apple Developer Documentation
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Apple Developer Documentation page for UIBackgroundExtensionView, a UIKit class that extends content to fill its own bounds. The documentation covers the class overview, instance properties, inheritance relationships, protocol conformances, and related APIs for iOS 26.0+, iPadOS 26.0+, Mac Catalyst 26.0+, tvOS 26.0+, and visionOS 26.0+.
metadata.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

treeStructure.text: Supporting Dark Mode in your int...

filterControl.icon: three horizontal lines with filter icon

content.text: A view that extends content to fill its own bounds.

A background extension view can be laid out to extend outside the safe area, such as under a sidebar or an inspector. By default, the view lays out its content to stay within the safe area, and uses modifications of the content along the edges to fill the container view.

content.description: Controls the automatic safe area placement of the contentView within the container.
The content view to extend to fill the UIBackgroundExtensionView.

Add this interaction to a container view of views that overlay the edge of a scroll view. Any descendants of this view that should affect the shape of the edge effect, such as labels, images, glass views, and controls, will automatically do so.

pages.pageSummary: Apple Developer Documentation page for UIBackgroundExtensionView class. The page presents a three-column layout with left navigation sidebar showing UIKit hierarchy, main content area with class documentation, and right sidebar showing related API topics. The main content includes the class declaration with @MainActor attribute, overview explaining safe area extension behavior, two instance properties (automaticallyPlacesContentView and contentView), inheritance from UIView, conformance to 27 protocols, and a See Also section referencing UIScrollEdgeElementContainerInteraction. Footer contains comprehensive navigation to Apple Developer resources, programs, and events.

crossPageElements.runningFooters: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

sections.title: Class Overview
sections.summary: Introduction to UIBackgroundExtensionView class including declaration, platform availability (iOS/iPadOS/Mac Catalyst/tvOS/visionOS 26.0+), and overview describing its purpose for extending content outside safe areas.

subsections.title: Instance Properties
subsections.summary: Two properties: automaticallyPlacesContentView (Bool) for safe area placement control, and contentView (UIView?) for the content to extend.

sections.summary: API reference topics section documenting the two instance properties available on UIBackgroundExtensionView.

subsections.title: Conforms To
subsections.summary: Lists 27 protocol conformances including CALayerDelegate, Sendable, UIAccessibilityIdentification, UIAppearance, UIFocusEnvironment, UITraitEnvironment, and others.

sections.summary: Type hierarchy and protocol conformance information for UIBackgroundExtensionView.

sections.summary: Related API reference to UIScrollEdgeElementContainerInteraction for handling scroll edge effects with overlaying views.

sections.summary: Comprehensive footer with links to Apple Developer platforms, tools, topics, resources, support, account management, programs, and events. Includes feedback link, theme toggle, copyright notice, and legal links.

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The document follows standard Apple Developer Documentation layout with a persistent header navigation, three-column layout (left sidebar for navigation hierarchy, center for main content, right sidebar for contextual topics), and a comprehensive footer. The main content flows from class identification (name, description, platform availability), through declaration, overview explanation, API topics (properties), type relationships (inheritance and protocol conformance), related APIs, and finally to the site-wide footer navigation.

keyTerms.definition: A UIKit class that extends content to fill its own bounds, laying out content outside the safe area such as under sidebars or inspectors.
The area of the screen where content can be displayed without being obscured by system UI elements like the status bar, navigation bar, or tab bar.
Swift concurrency attribute indicating that the class must be accessed from the main thread.
A Boolean property that controls whether the content view is automatically placed within the safe area of the container.
An optional UIView property representing the content view to extend to fill the UIBackgroundExtensionView.
An interaction class for container views that overlay scroll view edges, allowing descendants like labels, images, glass views, and controls to affect edge effect shape.
A category of UIKit appearance customization APIs including UIGlassEffect and UIGlassContainerEffect.

keyFindings: UIBackgroundExtensionView is available starting in iOS 26.0, iPadOS 26.0, Mac Catalyst 26.0, tvOS 26.0, and visionOS 26.0.
The class is marked with @MainActor for thread safety in Swift concurrency.
By default, the view keeps content within the safe area while extending modifications to fill the container.
The class inherits from UIView and conforms to 27 protocols.
The class is part of the Liquid Glass effects and appearance customization APIs in UIKit.
Related API UIScrollEdgeElementContainerInteraction handles interaction between content and scroll view edges.

instanceProperties.name: automaticallyPlacesContentView
instanceProperties.description: Controls the automatic safe area placement of the contentView within the container.

instanceProperties.name: contentView
instanceProperties.description: The content view to extend to fill the UIBackgroundExtensionView.

designDecisions.rationale: By default, content stays within safe area for standard accessibility and usability, with edge modifications used to fill the container view.
Ensures thread safety by requiring main thread access, consistent with UIKit view hierarchy requirements.
